    • takeMove

      public int takeMove(int x, int y)
      Called when a user clicks on a position on the board, setting its value if legal and checking for victory
      Parameters:
      x - : first index to set
      y - : second index to set
      Returns:
      -1 if no winner, otherwise 1 or 2 for Player 1 or 2 winning respectively

    • allMatch

      private boolean allMatch(int x, int y, int min, int max, int diff, boolean vertical)
      Method that takes a minimum and maximum number, and searches if all elements on a line for those x values match the value at the origin. Note that the origin can be on the edge of a line or the middle, depending on the values of min and max. The 'diff' argument is used to check for diagonals, searching with y + 1 or y - 1 at each step for upwards and downwards diagonals respectively. Vertical lines are checked differently, with no change in x-values.
      Parameters:
      x - : First index of starting position
      y - : Second index of starting position
      min - : Lowest x-value difference to check
      max - : Highest x-value difference to check
      diff - : How much to increment y-value while continuing
      vertical - : Flag that does a different check for no x-difference (i.e. vertical line)
      Returns:

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the game, setting basic parameters to run again

    • getBoardState

      public String[] getBoardState()
      Testing method that returns an array of strings, each representing a line on the board Notation is | Value | Value | Value |, with a number of values equal to the number of columns and with Value representing X, O, or " " if the space has yet to be selected.
      Returns:
      String array where each element represents one row of the Tic Tac Toe board
